text: Our Democratic process benefited from having @amyklobuchar's voice in the race. I know she'll continue fighting for progress in Washington, D.C.

Live in Benicia and looking for ways to serve your community? Take a look at openings for local boards & commissions. Topics range from Arts, Sustainability, Historic Preservation, Libraries, Open Space, Housing, Planning & more. https://www.ci.benicia.ca.us/index.asp?SEC=168344BF-D432-4104-A49E-CCC4A509780B&DE=9C9F472E-22C7-4EF2-9728-532CF27290C9&Type=B_PR

The #Prop13SchoolBond on your March 3 ballot will allocate critical funding to repair and upgrade our local schools and public universities -- all without impacting our tax rates. Delaying would only increase our long-term costs. That's why I'm supporting this important measure.

Election Day is Tuesday, March 3rd. Be sure to vote in this critical Primary Election. We need to choose the Democratic standard bearer who can win in November and get things done to advance equity, opportunity, sustainability & prosperity. That’s why I’m endorsing @JoeBiden.
Thanks to @PeteButtigieg for his unflappable campaign and commitment to moving America forward. I know he’ll continue working to advance our Democratic values.

Thanks to everyone who came out to my Senior Issues Forum in Pleasant Hill today. If you weren't able to attend, you can check out the resource list on my website https://sd03.senate.ca.gov/senior-resources.

Access to clean, affordable water is a human right, but too many low-income families face water shutoffs or choices between water and food or rent. @NextGen_Policy @LCJandA @policylink @CRLAFoundation @foodandwater @clcv @PCLeague @cejapower @CalRivers @WhollyH2o @LWVC @EJCW @ewg

The @CaWaterBoards released its report required by my Low-Income Water Rate Assistance Act, detailing a plan to realize the guarantee of the human right to water in CA. Thanks to @NRDC @NRDCWater @cleanh2oca @cleanh2oaction @CWaterC @UCLALuskin & others.
You can learn more about visiting Jack London State Park here: https://jacklondonpark.com/. @calparks @Sonoma_Valley @jacklondonpark

Happy to be on hand to honor Tjiska Van Wyk for her 8 years as Executive Director of @jacklondonpark. She did incredible work to boost visitorship and improve the natural & historic elements of the park. If you haven't been to Jack London State Park, check it out this weekend!

Proud to earn the @NapaRegister endorsement for re-election to the Senate. We've made progress over the last few years, but there's still much we need to accomplish and I'm eager to continue fighting to advance our region and all of CA.

Hope to see you this Friday, 2/28 at 9:30AM at my Senior Issues Forum at the Pleasant Hill Senior Center. We'll have a panel of experts to discuss important services and resources. @PleasantHill_CA @PleasantHillRec @ChoiceinAging @CCCounty

It's Eating Disorders Awareness Week. If you or a loved one are struggling, help is available. The NEDA Helpline is open Mons-Thurs 6am-6pm Pacific Time and Fridays 6am-2pm. To speak to a Helpline Volunteer live please call 800-931- 2237 or chat online at http://www.nationaleatingdisorders.org/helplinechat.

Standing with @PPNorCalAction & @PPActionCA for women's reproductive rights is the right thing to do. I'll continue to make sure CA sets the national standard for putting women's health and rights first.

CA is the fifth-largest economy in the world, and no woman in our state should go without top-notch maternity care. The disparity in outcomes for women & infants of color is absolutely unacceptable and my bill will help address that appalling disparity. #SB1237

I introduced #SB1237 to improve access to high-quality maternity care. Nurse-Midwives improve outcomes for mothers and babies, especially those in rural or inner-city settings. Thanks to coauthor @AsmAutumnBurke, @cnmamidwives & @BW4WLA

It's Eating Disorders Awareness Week. 30 million Americans suffer from an eating disorder at some point in their lives. Join @fionama, @NEDAstaff, @CieloHouse, @EDRCSV & me in raising awareness, so we can help connect people with resources & support.
Working with @CMUA_Tweets in introducing a new bill to ensure critical facilities continue to operate in the event of a power outage. We need to make sure that public health and safety are protected.

.@GavinNewsom's #StateOfTheState made clear that he's committed to addressing our key issues, especially housing & homelessness. He's demonstrated the vision, values & vigor to get the job done. CA is an enterprising, pluralizing state of dreamers & doers.

Unfortunately, chronic hunger is far too common on our campuses. My new bill will put food on the table for those who are struggling, helping more Californians achieve their educational & career goals. Thanks to @_UCSA & Coalition of CA Welfare Rights Orgs
Counting every Californian in the upcoming #2020Census is critical to getting the federal money & representation we deserve. Read my column in the @woodlandnews. #BeCounted @CACompleteCount

Rural landowners play a huge role in conservation and are critical to the economic vitality of our state. Working with @Conserve_CA & others, I introduced a bill today to help farmers & ranchers build on their environmental stewardship and sustainability.

We must hold utilities accountable for operating safely and reliably by tying their compensation to achieving these goals. A performance-based model would discourage the type of reckless behavior responsible for devastating wildfires and power outages.

Incredible generosity supporting the great work of the @BGCSonoma at the annual Sweetheart Gala. Also, congratulations to Matt Sevenau on being honored for his contributions to the Boys & Girls Club of Sonoma Valley.
Attention artists and community groups. The @CalArtsCouncil just launched a new Innovations + Intersections grant program. Learn more on their website.

I introduced #SB918 today to allow Dept. of Viticulture and Enology at @UCDavis to sell their surplus wine instead of dumping it. The bill will generate funds for this great program that trains future leaders in winemaking. @UCD_RMI

.@sonomasheriff Mark Essick used hi-lo sirens to help evacuate residents in @CountyofSonoma during the Kincaid Fire. My new bill would help other communities use it as a tool to assist in evacuations during disasters and help save lives. #SB909

Glad to work with @NapaSheriff John Robertson to introduce a bill to improve emergency evacuations and public safety. The bill authorizes public safety agencies to use European-style “hi-lo” sirens to alert people of evacuations. @CountyofNapa @calsheriffs
Nice picture John!
Proud to recognize the men and women of the Solano County Sheriff's Office at this ceremony for newly sworn, promoted and retiring deputies. @SolanoSheriff

Great questions and conversation at American Canyon Middle School. They asked how to make laws, what I thought was my biggest impact as a senator & what I think of the power of youth to inspire change (a lot!) Thanks to teacher Sarah Grant & Principal Dan Scudero. @acmswildcats

As we enter a new decade, CA faces increasing environmental challenges caused by climate change, creating an uncertain future for our water resources. We need bold leadership to address these impacts - especially on the Delta. https://www.sacbee.com/opinion/op-ed/article239570243.html#storylink=cpy
Happy #LunarNewYear to everyone observing it. May this New Year bring you happiness and prosperity!
It’s never too early to plan for fire season. Check out these tips from @CAL_FIRE
CA will not back down on supporting women's rights and access to reproductive healthcare. We #StandWithPP @PPActionCA @PPNorCalAction
Thanks to Leadership Vallejo for allowing me and @AsmGrayson to speak with you this morning. Great group of leaders in @CityofVallejo.

Educating our children is priority one. Communities stricken by PG&E’s poorly executed power outages shouldn’t be forced to endure losses to their school budgets. My bill will help ensure school districts are made whole. #SB884
Congrats Chancellor May!

Gov @GavinNewsom is absolutely right to object to PG&E’s still-flawed plan. It’s clear that while PG&E & its hedge fund backers are acting with narrow self-interest, the governor and the Legislature are going to continue to fight for the public’s interest.
Thanks to @ICRicardoLara for standing with Disaster Victims and sponsoring #SB872 to cut through insurance red tape.

When someone loses their home in a disaster, they shouldn’t have to jump through hoops to get coverage they're entitled to. That's why I've introduced a new bill to streamline claims & speed payments to victims. #SB872 #CutTheRedTape
Hope to see you at our Open House tonight (Friday, 1/17) at my Napa District Office.

Power shutoffs must be limited in scope & duration, which is something PG&E has so far failed miserably at. Utilities must protect vulnerable populations, and we must ensure local governments have the ability & resources to respond.
Join @RepThompson, @AsmAguiarCurry and me at our Napa Valley Open House on Friday, 1/17 at 5pm. @CountyofNapa

I appreciate @GvainNewsom's continued investment in wildfire prevention & emergency prep. This proposed budget makes critical investments in bolstering education, combating homelessness & saving for a rainy day. Looking forward to building on his framework
Thanks for being there! Appreciated your enthusiastic testimony.

Dutch helped make the swearing-in especially memorable! Thanks to @CAgovernor @GavinNewsom for incredible vision, energy and leadership in his first year in office. Looking forward to building on our progress in 2020.
Proud to #StandwithPP in fighting for healthcare and women's rights. Thanks to @PPActionCA and @PPNorCalAction for standing up for women's health and reproductive freedom!

Safety must come first in horse racing. Today I introduced #SB800 to improve safety for horses & jockeys. This builds on reforms in #SB469 which was signed by Gov. @GavinNewsom, giving @caCHRB authority to halt racing when dangerous conditions exist.
Appreciate this information from CalFire CalOES
I authored 16 new laws going into effect this month, including measures to enhance wildfire safety, protect the elderly, promote new housing and improve transportation.

The CA Consumer Privacy Act took effect Jan 1, giving you significant new transparency and control for consumers private data. Proud to coauthor this nation-leading law with @SenateHertzberg & @AsmEdChau. #AB375 #CCPA https://www.davisenterprise.com/forum/commentary-californians-get-new-protections-on-data-privacy/

Illegal sports betting is widespread. It’s critical that we bring it out of the shadows to make it safer & generate funds for education. The Legislature’s job is to stand up for the public interest and ensure CA adopts the best possible model.

We all know that we can't trust PG&E to do the right thing or even follow the law. @CAgovernor @GavinNewsom is standing up for the interests of ratepayers, victims & communities. We need systemic change in the structure and governance of PG&E to ensure safe, reliable power.

I'm running for re-election because we need to build a vibrant, sustainable state that we can be proud to leave to the next generation. We need to build on our progress on education investment, healthcare, transportation & housing, consumer protection & environmental stewardship.

It's official! I've filed for reelection to the CA State Senate. Serving as your Senator & representing our incredible district is my great honor. We've made some real progress in recent years, but we still have much work to do. Visit http://www.billdodd.com to learn more.

Thanks to Insurance Commissioner Lara for taking this important action. Non-renewals cause uncertainty & threaten instability in communities already reeling from wildfires. We need to do everything we can to advance the availability & affordability of quality insurance coverage.

Thanks to @Chancellor_May & the team at @ucdavis for partnering with me to pass #SB442 to spur innovation & collaboration between @UofCalifornia & @CAStateParks. Great to visit with the groundbreaking faculty, researchers & professionals at #UCDavis. @UCDavisResearch @UCDavisNews

I'm hosting a Power Shutoff & Wildfire Safety Town Hall on 11/25 at 6pm at the Sonoma Vets Hall. Status quo at PG&E is unacceptable & I'm calling for fundamental change in governance/control of the troubled utility. Your questions & comments are encouraged.https://bit.ly/2D7r7mE

I'm hosting a Power Shutoff & Wildfire Safety Town Hall tonight, 11/19 at 6pm at Napa Valley College. The status quo at PG&E is unacceptable. I'm calling for fundamental change to the governance and control of the troubled utility. You'll hear from a panel of experts + Q&A.
Thanks to @SenKamalaHarris and @RepHuffman for pushing federal action to address wildfire risks.

Proud to earn the @CA_Dem endorsement for re-election. Thanks to all the CA Dem Party delegates for your support. Representing #Solano, #Sonoma, #Napa, #Yolo, #ContraCosta & #Sacramento Counties in the Senate is an incredible honor. Together, we’ll protect & expand our progress.

Great showing by all the candidates at the @CA_Dem Presidential Forum. Clear that all of them would move our nation forward - advancing equity and opportunity. From healthcare to immigration to education to the environment & climate change, we can't afford 4 more years of Trump!

Congrats to @LongBeachMayor @RobertGarciaLB and @LongBeachCity for doing a great job hosting the @CA_Dem Convention this week. Well done! Amazing energy this weekend from thousands of grassroots activists ready to take back the White House in 2020.
Getting underway at the @CA_Dem @UnivisionNews Presidential Candidates Forum with the incomparable @wmjorgeramos. @KamalaHarris up first, talking about the importance of gun control and safe schools.

Thanks to @CA_Dem Party Chair @rustyhicks & all the delegates for coming to our 6th NorCal After-Party at the CA Dem Convention with @ilike_mike @JimWoodAD2 @CeciliaAD4 & @AsmGrayson. Tremendous energy & dedication to moving our country forward & carrying the #BlueWave into 2020.
At the @CA_Dem Convention today. CA stands with @PPActionCA, women's rights and healthcare. #IStandWithPP @PPNorCalAction @PPAdvocatesMM @PPFA
Andy, thanks for the @. My policy team will look into the issue and what we can do to help address it.

The @SonomaLandTrust is doing incredible work to protect and enhance Sonoma County. Great to join new Executive Director Eamon O'Byrne and Wendy Eliot for an update on the progress on wetland restoration around the San Pablo Bay.

On the one-year anniversary of the wildfires in Paradise, we remember the 85 lives lost, their loved ones, and those who are still working to rebuild. We also recognize the spirit, resiliency and humanity shown in the face of tragedy.
I'm holding a mobile home summit this Sunday, 11/10 at 1:30pm at the Napa Masonic Lodge (4125 Solano Ave.). Come to learn about the rights of mobile home owners and the community issues they face.

Congratulations to Los Cien on 10 years of incredible work! Los Cien has done a tremendous job working on empowering the North Bay's Latino Community and advancing understanding, equity and opportunity.

Hear from experts about important issues facing seniors in Napa County Such as emergency preparation, healthcare & benefits at my Napa Senior Issues Forum on 11/20. The forum will connect residents with information, services and resources.

Wonderful community champions honored at @NorthBayLeaders "Leaders of the North Bay": Ben Stone for lifetime achievement with @SonomaEDB, Ross Liscum, @SonomaFirst5, Sutter Santa Rosa, @YMCAMarin's Don Carney & Voces de Cambio. Great Keynote from Mirna Mejia Munguia! @Cynleader

No doubt about it, we need fundamental change to PG&E structure and governance. Looking forward to working with @GavinNewsom and my colleagues in the Legislature to do everything we can to put ratepayers and public safety in the best possible position.

Thanks to @CAgovernor @GavinNewsom for coming back to American Canyon today to highlight resources available to people impacted by the wildfires and power shutoffs. We'll continue partnering to hold PG&E accountable and improve public safety.
Sonoma County evacuees, please read this re-population announcement from the Sonoma County Sheriff's Office.

With @RepThompson and local officials surveying the fire damage at CSU @Cal_Maritime in Vallejo. Kudos to Admiral Cropper & team on a safe evacuation and incredible work by first responders protecting the campus from major damage.

The Legislature has given the CA Public Utilities Commission power to regulate power shutoffs. It’s clear PG&E can’t be trusted with any latitude. I appreciate Pres. Batjer initiating an investigation & issuing a ruling to address this critical situation.

Thanks to all the CAL FIRE and mutual aid firefighters from around the state fighting to keep CA safe. Incredible work under difficult circumstance. All first reponders have been doing yeoman's work protecting lives and homes. Everyone, stay safe!
Remember, a signal light without power doesn't mean you can speed through it. It's treated as a stop sign. Please stay safe out there.

Anyone who has been the victim of illegal price gouging, or who has information regarding potential price gouging, is encouraged to immediately file a complaint with the Attorney General's Office by going to the Attorney General's website or by calling (800) 952-5225.
Thanks to all the @CAL_FIRE and mutual aide firefighters from across CA for helping protect lives and homes in Sonoma County in these difficult conditions. Please stay safe.
To everyone receiving evacuation orders in Sonoma County, please follow them for your safety. My thoughts and prayers are with all evacuees, firefighter and first responders. Stay Safe!!!

Check out @KQED's Political Breakdown tonight at 6:30pm where I'm joining @mlagos & @scottshafer for a wide-ranging discussion. Shout out to @GuyMarzorati for the meticulous research for the interview.

The hard working men & women on the front lines for PG&E deserve our support. Threats and violence are unacceptable. These people live in our neighborhoods and have nothing to do with the gross mismanagement of PG&E executives.

I'll be in Winters on 10/30 with @AsmAguiarCurry for the Yolo County Older Adult Town Hall hosted by the Yolo Healthy Aging Alliance, Agency on Aging Area 4 & Yolo County. Good opportunity to learn and share your thoughts. Hope to see you there. https://sd03.senate.ca.gov/event/20191021-winters-senior-town-hall-oct-30

Grant applications open today for @CDFAnews CA's State Water Efficiency and Enhancement Program (SWEEP), which provides grants for irrigation systems that reduce GHGs & save water on agricultural operations. Learn more about & see if you could qualify: https://www.cdfa.ca.gov/oefi/sweep/

Open Enrollment is here! Almost 1 million people can qualify for financial help from @CoveredCA to lower the cost of health insurance. You may now qualify even if you didn’t in the past. Or, you may receive even more help than you did before! Visit

October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month. Many of us have loved ones who have been affected by breast cancer. Early detection through screenings and mammograms can save lives. CA's Every Woman Counts Program provides free services to low-income women.

No trick, @ilike_mike @AsmAguiarCurry & I will be talking Central Valley grape growing & enology in Lodi at 10am on 10/31. Treat yourself to the livestream of the joint Select Committee on Wine info hearing. What better way to kick off your Halloween? https://sd03.senate.ca.gov/news/20191017-legislative-wine-committees-meet-lodi
https://sd03.senate.ca.gov/news/20191017-legislative-wine-committees-meet-lodi

Thanks to everyone who came out to my Senior Issues Forums this week in Vacaville and Suisun. https://www.dailyrepublic.com/all-dr-news/solano-news/vacaville/people-pack-mcbride-center-for-senior-forum/

We've tackled some important issues in the Legislature this year, but the work goes on. They key is to maintain our progress on making California a better place to live and work. And we have plenty of challenges left to address.
To my constituents in Crockett & all first responders - STAY SAFE!
The reality of living in the Bay Area means earthquakes can and will happen. Take steps to prepare and plan to protect your home and loved ones.

I commend @GavinNewsom for demanding a review into the scope & timing of last week’s poorly handled power shutoff by PG&E. It was severely bungled on the part of PG&E, and it can’t be allowed to happen again. https://sd03.senate.ca.gov/news/20191014-sen-dodd-responds-pge-power-shutoff-action

Thanks to @CAgovernor @GavinNewsom for signing my #SB235 into law. Napa is now a step closer to getting long-sought affordable and market-rate housing for our workforce, which will help reduce commute traffic.
Once again our first responders are doing a great job!

Thanks to @CSAC_Counties @CaCities @MTCBATA @UnitedContrs @NVTA_NapaValley @SACOG @ABAGSFBayArea @Transport_CA @AAASoCal @AAA_NCNU @DavidRabbitt @CalAPAnews @CCCounty @CityofSac & others for supporting #SB137. This new law will help local govs accomplish transportation projects.

For years PG&E has done a poor job on maintenance and tree clearing, and they’re still not even close to where they need to be. That fact, along with breakdowns in communication, are unacceptable. Sadly, poor performance by PG&E is par for the course, so it’s not surprising.”

My bill to move critical transportation projects forward in a quicker, more efficient manner was signed by @CAgovernor @GavinNewsom. It will ultimately help complete more project with our existing resources.
Check out the latest @ThenTheresCA Podcast with me and Napa County Fire Chief Geoff Belyea discussing the 2017 wildfires, lessons learned & new policies to protect the public.

Looking back on the 2017 Wildfires & how far we've come, it’s heartening to see our community come together & work so hard to rebuild. At the same time, we can’t overlook those still struggling. Helping our neighbors & protecting CA from fires is paramount.
Just spoke with Mayor Leon Garcia: update 30% contained and evacuation center closing.
Thank Gov. @GavinNewsom for signing my bill to improve the often frustrating experience of filing an insurance claim. #SB240
Acting Governor @toniatkins! California couldn't be in better hands with @GavinNewsom & @EleniForCA out of the state.

Looking for something to do this Saturday? Join me on 10/5 in Sonoma at historic Buena Vista Winery for a reception from 5:30-7pm. Hope to see you at CA's oldest winery for amazing wine, tasty treats and great company. https://tinyurl.com/SenDoddSonoma

Thanks to @UofCalifornia, @ucdavis & @Chancellor_May for supporting this important law which will allow researchers to better utilize scientific discoveries made in @CAStateParks to advance the public good. #SB442 #Science #Innovation

.@GavinNewsom signed #SB442, my bill to enable collaboration & innovation between the state Dept of Parks and Recreation and universities/researchers. It will encourage discovery + allow CA to realize substantial social, ecological & economic benefits

Thanks to @CAgovernor @GavinNewsom for signing all for of my wildfire preparedness and prevention bills. We need to do everything we can to put the safety of our neighbors and communities first, and these new laws will go a long way towards that goal.

Thanks to @Conserve_CA @CalTrout @CSAC_Counties @AudubonCA @ASCERegion9 @cleanh2oca @TroutUnlimited @UCSUSA @sonomawater @RuralCounties @SierraClubCA @SFBaySierraClub @SierraClubRC @ACWAWater @capsscientists @PCLeague &others for supporting my bill to protect our water resources

Thanks to @CAgovernor @GavinNewsom for signing #SB19 to use stream gages to better manage our precious water resources. It will help our environment, domestic water use & farmers by enabling informed and targeted actions to address water quality & supply.
Thanks to Gov @GavinNewsom for honoring Native Americans and the tribal nations throughout California for all they have done and continue to do to for our state.
My event in Sonoma at Buena Vista Winery is coming up next week on Saturday, October 5th. Looking forward to a great time at California's oldest winery. Hope you can join us.

Thanks to @GavinNewsom's strike team, DMV is now phasing in a program to accept credit card payments at their offices, starting with Davis office on 9/30. Full rollout in all field offices expected by early 2020. I've been an advocate of getting this (far from new) tech for years
Today is #NationalVoterRegistrationDay. If you've moved or become eligible to vote, make sure to register and have your vote heard. If you're 16 or 17 years old, you can also pre-register to vote.
Looking forward to a great event in Sonoma on 10/5.
Thanks to everyone who came out to support Delta Watershed Protection Week at volunteer cleanups.

Thanks to the hundreds of people from across our region taking part in Delta Cleanup Day and Coastal Cleanup Day! Heartening to have so many people giving their time to protect our environment and the beauty of our waterways. #CaliforniaForAll #CoastalCleanupDay
Thanks to @GavinNewsom for recognizing the sacrifices of service members and their loved ones on POW/MIA Recognition Day.
Properly installing car seats and securing children can save lives. All too often they are improperly installed, and I hope this week brings awareness to this situation - preventing future tragedies.
https://patch.com/california/sonomavalley/calendar/event/20191005/645174/an-evening-at-buena-vista-winery-with-senator-bill-dodd

On the last night of the legislative session, happy to advance my 17th bill of the year to the Gov's Desk. #SB442 will empower our public universities & researchers to partner with @CAStateParks. The UC & @ucdavis sponsored the bill to spur innovation.
Long night in the Capitol, but happy to announce we just passed #SB235, my bill to help advance critical housing for Napa County. Next stop, @GavinNewsom's desk.
Join @SonomaRCD, @sonomawater, @PetalumaCityGov, Friends of the Petaluma River & others for Coastal Cleanup Day.
https://www.dailyrepublic.com/all-dr-news/solano-news/rio-vista/delta-week-includes-cleanup-day-with-single-solano-site/
Thanks to @SenToniAtkins for your partnership and steadfast commitment to protect all Californians from wildfires. We've made progress this year, and we'll continue building on it.
The Legislature passed 3 of my bills to improve wildfire prevention, preparedness and response. We must be proactive to get a handle on wildfire risks before they claim lives and property.
It's been 18 years since 9/11/2001. We will #neverforget the lives that were lost and the bravery of first responders who put themselves in harms way to help others. #PatriotDay

Thanks also to @CCCounty, @ABAGSFBayArea, @AlamedaCTC, @AAASoCal, @CalAPAnews, @SACOG @TheCityofSac & @countiesurban for supporting this important bill to help speed and complete more transportation projects. #SB137

My bill to reduce costs and delays for transportation projects passed the Legislature. Now it heads to @GavinNewsom for his signature. Thanks to @CSAC_Counties @CaCities @Transport_CA @MTCBATA @UnitedContrs @NVTA_NapaValley & @AAA_NCNU for the support!
Thanks to everyone who came out to the Seeking Solutions Community Policing Forum in Vallejo this weekend.
The Legislature passed my bill to better manage our state's precious water supply. Now #SB19 heads to @GavinNewsom for his signature. #Sustainable #Water #CaliforniaForAll
Sonoma Ready Day is coming up this weekend. Emergency preparedness is so important and can save lives. Hope to see you there. #SonomaReadyDay @CountyofSonoma

The Legislature just passed my bill to help protect vulnerable, low-income and medically fragile residents during power shutoffs. Utilities must minimize the impact of these shutoffs and ensure safety. Now #SB167 heads to @GavinNewsom for his signature.
Thanks to @CAgovernor @GavinNewsom for signing #SB20, my bill to empower Napa County to preserve Skyline Wilderness Park as a community resource in perpetuity. #CaliforniaForAll #ParksMakeLifeBetter

In recognition of its significance to California, the Legislature is declaring Sept. 21 through Sept. 27 as Delta Watershed Protection Week. It kicks off Sept. 21 with Delta Waterway Cleanup Day. Check out opportunities to volunteer. #DeltaProtectionWeek
Thanks to my colleagues on both sides of the aisle for approving my bill to increase glass recycling, reduce waste and lower GHG emissions.
My bill to help disaster victims get their insurance claims resolved passed the Legislature today with unanimous, bipartisan support. Now it heads to @GavinNewsom's desk.
Thanks to @scottlay & @GibranJitsu for having me on #SacTownTalks. Great discussion.

College access and affordability is absolutely critical. This year, the Legislature and @CAgovernor @GavinNewsom made important strides & new investments. Now first-time community college students attending school full-time can get 2 years of tuition-FREE community college.
Great Saturday at yet another ribbon cutting for Solano-Napa Habitat for Humanity as they open an affordable home for Veterans!

Proud to represent @YoloCountyCA that came together to raise over $9 million for a new @YoloFoodBank! Special thanks for the generosity of the Yocha Dehe Wintun Nation for their generous donation. #EndHunger

What an amazing night of generosity at the @svgreatschools annual Red & White Ball on the beautiful #Sonoma Plaza. @SVHSDragons Senior Luis Esteva gave a great speech on the impact of the programs SVUSD and the Sonoma Valley Ed Foundation support.

Sonoma Ready Day - an emergency preparedness fair - is coming up on September 8th at the Sonoma County Fairgrounds. Come by and check it out. Planning ahead can save lives. https://www.sonomacity.org/sonoma-ready-day-emergency-preparedness-fair-september-8th/
Great turnout at our Davis Senior Issues Forum. Thanks to everyone who came out, including our presenters.

My bill to help Napa County preserve Skyline Wilderness Park passed the Legislature today. We had unanimous, bipartisan support. Now it heads to Gov @GavinNewsom's desk. #SB20 #ParksForAll #CaliforniaForAll
Hope to see you at my Senior Issues Forum in Davis today.

With the 5th anniversary of the South Napa Earthquake coming up this week, it's a good reminder that we should all take steps to prepare for, survive and recover from future earthquakes. Here are some good tips:

Building our rainy day fund to avoid the booms & busts of the past is critical. Thanks to @JerryBrownGov for making savings & strategic investments a priority and for @CAgovernor @GavinNewsom for building on that foundation to ensure #CaliforniaForAll.

Napa County Resource Conservation District is hosting a Napa River Cleanup on 8/17 from 9:30-11:30am at Tulucay Creek Tidal Area. Volunteers make a difference in our watershed. https://www.facebook.com/events/515176785690659/

I had the privilege of serving with Jack Gingles on many boards & commissions. He was always collaborative & looking out for the people of Calistoga. His passing is truly a loss, and my deepest condolences go to his loved ones.

Hope to see you at my Senior Issues Forum at the Davis Senior Center on 8/22 at 2pm. We'll talk about important issues like healthcare and programs for seniors - and you can ask our expert panelists your questions.
Delighted to present a certificate of recognition to Sherrill Futrell of Davis for her amazing civic engagement. Not surprising for a retired civics teacher! She's an inspiration.
Great weekend supporting 4-H kids at the Junior Livestock Auction. Thanks to all the bidders for supporting our youth, our future! With Supervisor @AlfredoPedrozaR & Napa Vice Mayor @ssedgleynapa.
Thanks to @ilfiorello Olive Oil Company and owners Ann and Mark Sievers for an informative tour. A great example of agriculture in @Solano_County.
Thanks Fiona! I appreciate you coming to my event and for your loyal support over the years.

Great day visiting people at the @sonomafair, including the @SoCoDems . Thanks to the Board of Supes & Fair Board for making this wonderful community event possible. If you haven't been yet this year, check it out this weekend! #SonomaCountyFair

Thanks to @CAgovernor @GavinNewsom for supporting historic investment in early childhood education. It's so important for student success, equity and the future of our economy. We need universal preschool, and we're building toward it in CA.
